metadata.synopsis: Player clicks on elevator leading to the shadow-cursed lands. Nearby duergar butt in to let you know you don't look like you're in any shape to go up there. The land is cursed, and you need a moonlantern. Plays only once.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. goto -605.444; 5.317; 3844. Click on the grilled door.teleport S_UND_Elevator_Fort_FromShadowlands

51.speaker: Ward Magmar
51.text: Shit. You got one of Nere's Moonlanterns, jargh?

5.speaker: Ward Magmar
5.text: One of them pixie-lamps. If you're headin' to Moonrise, you won't last without it.

53.speaker: Ward Pistle
53.text: Top-lands are clogged with the death-dark, choke you in no time.

20.speaker: Player
20.text: 'Death-dark'? Sounds like my kind of thing. What is it?

26.speaker: Player
26.text: I've seen much death already... I'll be careful.

47.speaker: Ward Magmar
47.text: You daft? It's there in the name. Shadows up there, black as the Lowerdark. A few sniffs could fell an ogre.

8.speaker: Narrator
8.text: The surface is within reach. But it may be foolish to press on before finding this Nere.

21.speaker: Lae'zel
21.text: The surface is within reach. But it may be foolish to press on before finding this Nere.

46.speaker: Shadowheart
46.text: No surprises that there's danger ahead, but we're getting closer. Perhaps we should seek out Nere while we can, though.

9.speaker: Karlach
9.text: Sounds like bad news. I'd just as soon get that Moonlantern off Nere.

36.speaker: Narrator
36.text: That Moonlantern is key to our survival. And that means freeing Nere.

40.speaker: Player
40.text: That Moonlantern is key to our survival. And that means freeing Nere.

10.speaker: Player
10.text: We need to press on. Nere is a distraction.

22.speaker: Astarion
22.text: I'm one of the reasons people fear the shadows, but even I'd rather investigate this Moonlantern before going to the surface.

56.speaker: Wyll
56.text: I'm not so keen on taking a shadow-nap, myself. We need to free Nere and get that Moonlantern.

18.speaker: Gale
18.text: 'Death-dark' doesn't sound very inviting. Can't say I fancy our chances without freeing Nere and getting that Moonlantern.

2.speaker: Narrator
2.text: He speaks of the shadow curse. Moonrise must be close, but it would be foolish to press on before seeking out this Nere.

32.speaker: Lae'zel
32.text: He speaks of the shadow curse. Moonrise must be close, but it would be foolish to press on before seeking out this Nere.

41.speaker: Shadowheart
41.text: Sounds like the shadow curse. We must be getting close to Moonrise. Perhaps we should seek out this Nere while we can, though.

12.speaker: Karlach
12.text: Must be the shadow curse. We'll need Nere's lantern if we want to get through it.

39.speaker: Narrator
39.text: That Moonlantern is key to our survival. And that means freeing Nere.

30.speaker: Player
30.text: That Moonlantern is key to our survival. And that means freeing Nere.

49.speaker: Narrator
49.text: Chk - more time wasted. If only you feared the ghaik parasite half as much as you fear the dark.

0.speaker: Lae'zel
0.text: Chk - more time wasted. If only you feared the ghaik parasite half as much as you fear the dark.

14.speaker: Shadowheart
14.text: Let's just hope you're right. Otherwise we're just aiding the enemy.

23.speaker: Karlach
23.context: NodeContext: [Astarion - with a sigh before 'very well']

7.speaker: Astarion
7.text: Afraid of the dark, are we? Very well - let us save Nere, if we must.
7.context: NodeContext: [Astarion - with a sigh before 'very well']

11.speaker: Wyll
11.text: There we have it. Let 'Operation Free Nere' commence.

44.speaker: Player
44.text: Moonrise Towers holds the answers we seek. Curse or not, we can't turn back now.
44.context: NodeContext: Approving of the player's decision to press onwards through danger to their goal

19.speaker: Narrator
19.text: Forward, then. No curse will keep me from purification.
19.context: NodeContext: Approving of the player's decision to press onwards through danger to their goal

43.speaker: Lae'zel
43.text: Forward, then. No curse will keep me from purification.
43.context: NodeContext: Approving of the player's decision to press onwards through danger to their goal

48.speaker: Shadowheart
48.text: Good. After all we've been through, this is hardly the time to falter.
48.context: NodeContext: Approving of the player's decision to press onwards through danger to their goal

13.speaker: Karlach
13.text: You just want me to die in a cursed cloud so you can take my boots. Finally, the plot revealed.
13.context: NodeContext: Kidding but grim, not too much levity.

52.speaker: Astarion
52.text: Excellent. The less time I have to spend with these underdwarves, the better. Present company excluded, of course.

31.speaker: Wyll
31.text: So we're going up there without the lantern? I hope you know what you're doing.

16.speaker: Gale
16.text: A stab in the dark it is...

50.speaker: Astarion
50.text: If the cure's in Moonrise, we should go, Nere and his lantern be damned. After all, 'shadows' will be the least of our worries if we start to turn.

33.speaker: Wyll
33.text: The shadow curse. We'll need that Moonlantern from Nere to survive the journey to Moonrise Towers.

45.speaker: Gale
45.text: We were warned about the curse. Can't say I fancy our chances without a Moonlantern.

29.speaker: Player
29.text: Thanks for sharing. I'll keep it in mind.

54.speaker: Ward Magmar
54.text: Go on, get some air. But don't go cursing me if that shadow-shit snuffs you.

3.speaker: Player
3.text: Whatever. I'm not afraid of a few shadows.

55.speaker: Ward Magmar
55.text: Well, damn. Then go on up, take a stroll. Long as you keep your lips off our ale, I don't give two shits.

57.speaker: Ward Magmar
57.text: So if you're headin' Moonrise-way, you ain't gettin' far. Not without one of Nere's pixie-lamps.

4.speaker: Player
4.text: Of course I do. Why do you ask?

15.speaker: Ward Magmar
15.text: I ask 'cause you ain't gettin' far without one of them pixie-lamps.
